string.text: Hello, you...
The local caretaker, well, I dig into this old shit and occasionally keep records of it. And you're new here, don't you really know me?
No.

In general, listen. The longing is green here and you can hang yourself out of boredom, so the guys and I are slowly leaning on vodka here, only as you already guessed, it is forbidden by the statute. I know it's tight with cartridges here, Sugar doesn't sell them! I can fit it, though sovdepovskie only, zvinyay. And I also have a bronka and new night sights, are you interested? And all this for the usual vodyara! Don't think about it, I'm not that smart, this stuff has been lying in the warehouse for years anyway, not needed by anyone. As we agree, the stash is here at the base, in the garage where the UAZ is broken up, the goods will be right behind it.
You just open up to me like that. And what if they find out about your machinations with the warehouse?

Then don't come to the base for at least a month until the next helicopter, do you need it? It's very hard for everyone here and everyone understands this, so if such a rat comes running to the gates of the bunker, they will shoot you and even the professor will not punish you here. As if they were clean, there's honey. drugs and overalls are being traded.
Logically, then I won't bother you, only if I don't want to use the exchange services.
What can I exchange with you?

Here, look:
5 bottles = six packs 9x18
5 bottles = three packs 5.45x39
10 bottles = six packs 5.45x39
10 bottles = five packs 12x70
10 bottles = two packs 7.62x54
15 bottles + 3 thousands of rubles = five packs for PKP
20 bottles = outfit «Beryl»
20 bottles = 10 packs 23x75mm "Shrapnel"
20 bottles = 5 packs 23x75mm "Barricade"
25 bottles + 5 thousand rubles = shotgun KS-23
30 bottles = 2 night scopes - "Little" è "Saracen"
I brought vodka.
Great, choose.
Six packs 9x18
Three packs 5.45
Six packs 5.45
Give me the shotbucks.
Two packs 7.62
Five packs for the PKP.
«Beryl».
23x75mm "Shrapnel", bring it.
23x75mm "Barricade", bring it.
Give me your night scopes.
He beaconed his own, take it for the UAZ in the garage.
I've changed my mind.
Don't bother me, stalker.
Hello, who are you?
Can't you see by me? I am a military man, Sapsan is my call sign. Here I help our guys with equipment. Part-time technician. What's broken, so drag it to me.
And you probably need tools?

No! I was provided with what I needed, the equipment here is not simple for scientists, so it requires high-quality technical intervention... I fixed the old receiver, though it drives some kind of mud. It's been two years since our guys died in warehouses, and he broadcasts their voices.
Well, anomal zone like that... you never know what she can figure out. Anyway, I get it. Good luck to you here.
Yep-Yep? Damn, hello.
Hi, aren't you hot in your outfit?

Safety precautions, our laboratory specializes in working with psi fields and sometimes you have to conduct experiments with them right in the bunker, if you know what I mean. Plus, the suit has a good built-in cooling system. You just take it and stand in it under an ice shower, and water comes in through numerous holes. Joke, are you interested in anything?
Well, I want to know what's here and how.

Well, this is such a peculiar hole, and in the literal sense we are located at the bottom of a once-dried lake. We have a mobile laboratory here, a Peregrine Falcon is sitting next to us and he repairs our equipment if there is a need, but I think he can do yours for an appropriate fee. Over there in front of me, do you hear someone grumbling? This is our professor, he also lectured at my university. There are two hangars outside, in the hangar at number 2 we have something like a dining room, where an ordinary contractor is responsible for the economic part. In the next one we have a warehouse and only the aforementioned double bass has access to it, by the way, they call him Spirit. Well, I'm just Semenov, I help the professor in various experiments, I monitor the equipment, the state of artifacts. Periodically, by the way, different people still look in here. I have some knowledge of pharmaceuticals, so if you get sick, I will help you, and of course not for free. Professor Kruglov was also with us before, until he was transferred to SRI, he had some kind of report on the armed forces there
Yes, I just came to you for a light, and maybe some kind of job to find.
We have a lot of work, especially on the territory of the plant, there is always some kind of shit happening.
I'll ask you sometime.
I want to check my health.
Medicines are expensive now, so prepare 2000 in advance.
What about social guarantees? Okay, I'll go get the money and run.
I didn't find any problems in your health, come on, scratch.
Here you go, bloodsucker:
Now where I've been here... Yeah, now your health is not in danger.
Stalker, help us! Our bunker is under attack by zombies! You should be able to survive this weak emission!
Stalker, you saved us! Our bunker would have met certain doom if you didn't step in to help. To show my gratitude, come to me for a free upgrade to your psi-helmet!
Hello, stalker. What brings you here?
What can you tell me about the Brain Scorcher?

Hmm, well... The field researchers only skirt the edge of the facility, so the little we know is mostly hearsay; second hand. What we do know is its effects. It seems to invade the mind of any who journey too close. The symptoms include migraines, hallucinations, tunnel vision, and without sounding unprofessional, zombification. If I had to give a scientific estimation, I'd call it a remote psi-transmitter, though I'd have to conduct more invasive research before settling on that conclusion.
Professor, I need a psi-protection helmet. My task requires me to move through the Brain Scorcher area, and without it, I won't be able to complete it.

I assume you understand the risk of going through these psychically volatile areas, do you?... Oh, alright, I believe you do. You wouldn't ask me about it otherwise. Well, there has been this one model we've been working on carefully, but it remains unfinished, and it lacks final calibrations. We can give you the psi-helmet right now as it is for a humble sum of 10,000 RU, but then you'd have to deal with the risk of using untested hardware! There's one more possibility, though: we can speed up the calibration progress, but that would require us to use more funds, and for you to wait. It would cost you about 17,500 RU. If you are willing to part with such a sum, we'll begin utilizing it immediately to finish our calibrations, which should take approximately two days, give or take.

I assume you understand the risk of going through these psychically volatile areas, do you?... Oh, alright, I believe you do. You wouldn't ask me about it otherwise. Well, there has been this one model we've been working on carefully, but it remains unfinished, and it lacks final calibrations.
I'm in a hurry. I'll take the prototype.

If you insist. I am quite certain that your job requires your equipment to be in perfect operational condition... Oh, I nearly forgot: you can always take it back to us for a final calibration. If you feel something is wrong, head straight to us. We can't afford any losses. So, this will cost you 10,000 RU.
Here's the money. Thank you, professor.
Not at all. But I would like you to test it first. You can help us by disabling the psi-emitter in the laboratory just north of here. Let's hope it will guard your consciousness well...
I've decided to let you finish your work. Please calibrate this helmet thoroughly.

You don't know what relief this brings to me and my colleagues. Letting us finish the final calibrations will greatly minimize the risk of injury, and we really wouldn't want to feel guilty of supplying you with untested gear... So, since you've already provided financial aid to our cause, a final calibration should cost you about 8,000 RU, and you'll need to wait approximately two days.
I hope my patience will be worth the fully calibrated version.

Indeed it will be. Once we finish working on this helmet, you'll be able to wander around the Zone freely, without suffering the risk of any psi-damage, as its psi-protective potential will be maximized. So... it will be 17,500 RU.

Indeed it will be. Once we finish working on this helmet, you'll be able to wander around the Zone freely, without suffering the risk of any psi-damage, as its psi-protective potential will be maximized. Since you've helped us out, I may part with the device free of charge.
Alright, I'll wait for the fully calibrated psi-helmet. Work your magic.
Thank you, stalker. I shall commence final calibrations now. Come and visit me in a couple days.
Is it ready yet?
It is! Here you go. But I would like you to test it first. You can help us by disabling the psi-emitter in the laboratory just north of here. Let's hope it will guard your consciousness well...
Not yet. Please come back later.
I need to think about it.
Very well. Don't worry; we'll keep the psi-helmet for later.
You're in the wrong place, buddy... and you better leave before we make it the wrong time, too.
You looking for trouble or something? Get out of here before you find it!
Get lost, buddy. Do that, and we'll keep it peaceful.
